annotation.TEXT: So then, I finally figured out a way to get this game to run semi-properly (it was downright frustrating at first, but I eventually found a solution). In case you haven't read the description yet, a good portion of the footage you'll be seeing here is from the PC version of X4. Despite this...I can't help but show the intro from the console version. It just wouldn't feel complete without it.

I also wanted to show the original start screen as well. Everything you're seeing beyond this however is from the PC version (mostly since it's the only stable one I could get running and record at the same time). Either way, I've been wanting to do a playthrough on this game for a while now. There's not going to be much to it other than being a standard run with X, but then again, I haven't played this game in a while; So I figured it would be interesting to see how much of it I could remember as I went through.

Something else I feel that's worth mentioning by now: I'm playing this with the keyboard rather than a gamepad. While I generally prefer the latter when it comes to the X series, I couldn't get my controller to work with this version for some reason. In either case, I don't mind using the keyboard (even though for this game it can be killer on your fingers at times).

Web Spider isn't exactly what I'd call a difficult fight, but he can be tricky at times. This is mostly because you more or less need to be constantly on the move during this fight (at least for the first phase of it, anyways). The biggest danger here is getting caught in his webs - which not only lock you into place, but can also deal a rather large amount of damage in the process.

For the most part, my path through the bosses is going to be pretty standard as well, even though it's going to require some backtracking to get a few heart tanks in the end. Come to think of it, I'm actually not sure if there's an order you can go through in this game that gets you everything in one clean cycle. Either way, none of the Maverick weapons are outstanding enough to warrant going in some crazy boss order.

Lightning Web is the prime example of this. It actually works relatively well in terms of creating an extra space for you to wall-jump from (despite not lasting that long). When using it on enemies however, it's downright useless. Aside from the fact that you need to be at a specific range to even get the most out of this weapon, it deals barely any damage against most enemies. It can also stun a few specific enemies, but you can't fire any more webs or switch to your buster while this is in effect, making it rather pointless.

Now then, I'm sure anyone who remembers X7 and X8 more than I do can probably dispute me on this, but I honestly think X4 has one of the weakest weapon sets in the whole series. In terms of support-usage and finding secret items, they're not that bad. As far as combat purposes however (especially outside of boss fights), that's another story.

The Fourth Armor pieces as a whole are pretty decent for the most part (and incredibly broken in a few other parts). Aside from letting you dash in mid-air, the leg upgrade also allows you to hover for a short time. The hover itself isn't that useful (especially since it doesn't last that long if you start moving with it), but there are a few instances where it can come in handy.
